column1: Saint-Denis features a tropical monsoon climate (Köppen Am) with two distinct seasons: a hot and humid wet season from December to April and a very warm
column2: less humid drier season for the remaining seven months of the year
column3: with July to October qualifying as true dry season months. The dry season does typically feature relatively light rain
column4: but it is not wet enough to be a tropical rainforest climate. During the wet season
column5: tropical cyclones often affect the city.

column1: Saint-Denis is the most populous commune in the French overseas departments. The population of St Denis has grown substantially since 1954
column2: both in the commune and the metropolitan area. In the 62 years from 1954 to the census in 2016
column3: population has more than tripled. The annual rate of population growth has been lower in the 21st century than in the 20th century.
